0.title: Juvenile found guilty of rioting 20 years later in 2002 Gujarat riots case
0.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who was 15 years old in 2002, has been found guilty of rioting 20 years later in Gulbarg Housing Society massacre during Gujarat riots. A Juvenile Justice Board found him guilty of being part of a mob that attacked the housing society. As many as 69 people, including a former Congress MP, were killed in the massacre.

1.title: Deverakonda, Puri meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh after announcing JGM
1.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, director Puri Jagannadh and the team of 'JGM' met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Delhi on March 30. Producer Charmme Kaur shared some pictures from their meeting on her Twitter handle, along with a caption that read, "Team #JGM meets honourable Defence Minister of India, Rajnath Singh ji." Deverakonda and Charmme had announced the film on March 29.

2.title: Whatever happens offline, same takes place online: PM during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'
2.article_body: Interacting with students, parents and teachers during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' 2022, PM Narendra Modi said that whatever happens offline, the same takes place online. "This means the medium is not the problem. Irrespective of the medium, if our mind is delved into the subject, then it won't make a difference in grasping things," he added.

3.title: Nitish will not leave Bihar: JDU rejects speculation of him going to RS
3.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) refuted rumours of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar going to Rajya Sabha and said that Nitish will not leave Bihar. Taking to Twitter, JDU leader Sanjay Kumar Jha, said, "Shri Kumar has people's mandate to serve Bihar, and will continue to do so for the full term as Chief Minister. He is not going anywhere."

4.title: India voice of developing nations on climate change: Environment Min
4.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said India has emerged as the voice of developing nations on climate change issues. "India is among...few countries that not only set Nationally Determined Contributions in 2015 but achieved them before time," Yadav said in Lok Sabha. He further added that India's lifestyle can teach the world how to live in harmony with the environment.

5.title: What are the income tax rule changes effective from today?
5.article_body: Income from virtual digital assets (VDAs) will be taxed at 30% and losses incurred from one VDA can't be set off against income from another VDA. A cap of tax-free contributions up to â‚¹2.5 lakh will be imposed on Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) account. A surcharge on long term capital gains tax will be capped at 15% for all assets.

6.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to release in UAE with 0 cuts, director says 'Big victory'
6.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' will release in UAE on April 7. Director Vivek Agnihotri, who had claimed that the film had been "banned" in the country, expressed his happiness on Twitter, writing, "Big victory: Finally, got...censor clearance from UAE." In a statement, Vivek said while some people in India are calling it Islamophobic, an Islamic country passed it with zero cuts.

7.title: Startup founder flags bad roads in B'luru, Telangana Minister says 'move to Hyderabad'
7.article_body: Khatabook's Founder Ravish Naresh tweeted that despite startups in Bengaluru's HSR Layout and Koramangala generating billions of dollars in taxes, the areas' roads are bad and there were power cuts almost daily. "Many rural areas now have better basic infra than India's Silicon Valley," he wrote. Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao replied saying, "Pack your bags and move to Hyderabad."

8.title: Ask yourself when you study online, do you really study or watch reels: PM to students
8.article_body: Addressing students during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha', Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Ask yourself when you study online, do you really study or watch reels on social media?" PM Modi added that it is not the fault of online or offline education because it doesn't matter where you are, but how focused your mind is during the classes.

9.title: Over 16,000 Indian pilgrims visited Pakistan in last 5 yrs: Centre
9.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan informed Rajya Sabha that 16,831 Indian pilgrims visited Pakistan, while 2,119 Pakistani pilgrims visited India, from 2017 to 2021. According to the data, the highest annual number of Indian pilgrims who travelled to Pakistan was in 2021 (5,425), while the highest number of Pakistani pilgrims who came here was in 2017 (984).

10.title: Karnataka court orders probe against BJP minister over hate speech
10.article_body: A court ordered Karnataka Police to conduct a probe against BJP leader and Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister KS Eshwarappa over alleged hate speech. Eshwarappa had suggested that Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killers were Muslims, following which a complaint was filed. Such statements were made with the intention of creating enmity between Hindus and Muslims, as per the complaint.

11.title: Binance wins dismissal of US lawsuit over digital token sales
11.article_body: A US judge has dismissed a lawsuit accusing Binance of violating securities laws by selling unregistered tokens and failing to register as an exchange or broker-dealer. Digital token investors, who had bought nine tokens through Binance starting in 2017, claimed Binance failed to warn them about the "significant risks" of the purchase. The judge said the investors sued too late.

12.title: Man fined $7.2 million over 'Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist'
12.article_body: Canada's Supreme Court asked a man behind the 'Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist' to pay over C$9 million ($7.2 million) fine. Richard ValliÃ¨res was found guilty in 2016 of trafficking, fraud, and theft of maple syrup worth over $14.4 million between 2011 and 2012. ValliÃ¨res, at trial, had said he'd sold syrup for $8 million and made an $800,000 profit.

13.title: Bhagwant Mann moves resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab
13.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday moved a resolution in the state Assembly, seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab "for maintaining harmony and taking sentiments of people into account". "Chandigarh city was created as the capital of Punjab. In all past precedents, whenever a state has been divided, the capital remains with the parent state," the resolution stated.

14.title: Making anyone but Harmanpreet captain means repeating a mistake: Anjum
14.article_body: Ex-India captain Anjum Chopra said Harmanpreet Kaur should be India's captain across formats, adding that making anyone else the captain will be a mistake being repeated. Harmanpreet is currently the captain in T20Is with Mithali Raj leading India in ODIs and Test cricket. "Harmanpreet's aggressive approach brings the best out of the Indian team," stated Anjum.

15.title: Didn't share OTP but still lost â‚¹3.63 lakh: Mumbai woman tells police
15.article_body: A 25-year-old Mumbai-based woman allegedly lost â‚¹3.63 lakh to cyber fraud and claimed before the police that she did not share OTP with the fraudster who called her impersonating as a bank official. The victim further told the police that the man asked her to confirm if her number is linked to her net banking account and asked for OTP.

16.title: He played a hell of a knock, unbelievable: De Kock on Evin's 23-ball 55*
16.article_body: LSG opener Quinton De Kock termed batter Evin Lewis's 23-ball 55* against CSK as a hell of a knock and unbelievable, adding that Ayush Badoni's 9-ball 19* was as impressive. "We came out fighting and to come out on top is always special," stated De Kock. LSG recorded their maiden win in IPL history after beating CSK by six wickets.

17.title: Gautam Gambhir's reaction after LSG's win against CSK goes viral
17.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) mentor Gautam Gambhir's reaction after LSG's victory against CSK has gone viral on social media. Gambhir was seen jumping from his chair and throwing a punch in the air as soon as Ayush Badoni hit the winning runs. LSG chased down a target of 211 to win the match.

18.title: There's no truth to this: US on Pak PM's claim of 'foreign conspiracy' to oust him
18.article_body: The US has rejected Pakistan PM Imran Khan's allegations regarding US' role in a "foreign conspiracy" to oust him from power. "There's no truth to these allegations...We respect...Pakistan's constitutional process and the rule of law," the US State Department said. Earlier, Khan, during a speech, named US as the country that threatened them, but immediately retracted its name.

19.title: Police offered to arrest Will Smith, but Chris Rock said 'No, no, no': Oscars producer
19.article_body: Oscars producer Will Packer has said that Los Angeles police were ready to arrest Will Smith after he slapped Chris Rock during the Oscar ceremony. "They said we will go get him...Weâ€™re prepared to get him right now. Chris was like, 'No, no, no, I'm fine',"  Packer said. Will had slapped Chris for making a joke about his wife Jada.

20.title: 67-year-old woman from Mumbai loses â‚¹20 lakh to Bitcoin cyber fraud
20.article_body: A 67-year-old woman from Mumbai lost â‚¹20 lakh to cyber fraudsters impersonating as employees of a company dealing in Bitcoin investments. She said she saw an advertisement for Bitcoins on her phone and had clicked on the link out of curiosity. She realised she had been defrauded after the accused claimed her invested money was lost due to Ukraine-Russia war.

21.title: Over 35,000 cases involving Centre, state govts pending in SC: Centre
21.article_body: Addressing the  Parliament, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that over 35,000 cases involving the Centre and state governments have been pending in Supreme Court since 2017. Rijiju further informed that Centre's 1,807 cases are pending in the apex court and  it is the respondent in 6,104 pending cases. State governments are respondents in 20,637 pending cases, he further added.

22.title: HC summons BESCOM MD to explain delay in shifting transformers
22.article_body: Karnataka High Court has directed Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) Managing Director (MD) to appear before it on April 7 to explain the delay in shifting transformers from public footpaths. This comes after a father and his daughter were killed in a BESCOM transformer blast earlier this month. Transformers on footpaths "put the public at risk", the court said.

23.title: Section 144 imposed in UP's GB Nagar till April 30 in view of festivals, exams
23.article_body: Section 144 has been imposed in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district till April 30, the Police Commissionerate said. The order was passed keeping in view the upcoming festivals like Ramzan, Ram Navami, high school examinations and the General Legislative Council Election 2022. People will have to follow COVID-19 protocols in public places, the order stated.

24.title: Vehicular traffic to be shut for 6 hrs at Pune's Sinhagad Fort
24.article_body: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has ordered the closure of vehicular traffic from 6 am to 12 pm tomorrow at the Sinhagad Fort for an Indian Army event. The Army is organising the 'Narveer Tanaji Run'. As many as 352 people, including Army personnel and civilians, will be participating in the run which is from Rajgad Fort to Sinhagad Fort.

25.title: There's indication Putin is self-isolating, punishing advisers: Biden
25.article_body: US President Joe Biden said Russian President Vladimir Putin "seems to be self-isolating" amid the Ukraine war. "There's some indication that he has fired or put under house arrest some of his advisers," Biden added. "But I don't want to put too much stock in that at this time because we don't have that much hard evidence," he further said.

26.title: Amitabh Bachchan visits Rishikesh, performs puja and aarti at ghat
26.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan recently visited Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, and took part in religious rituals. Several pictures and videos of him doing puja have surfaced online. Amitabh was also seen doing Parmarth Ganga Aarti with Swami Chidanand Saraswati. "Ganga provokes divinity...embraces the soul in a way no other can...and emotes in a manner unknown to mankind," he wrote on his blog.

27.title: It plays on a batter's mind: Sandeep on dismissing Kohli most times in IPL
27.article_body: Talking about dismissing Virat Kohli seven times in the IPL which is the most number of times someone has dismissed him in the tournament, ex-SRH pacer Sandeep Sharma said it does play on a batter's mind. "You must have noticed them playing such bowlers with...more care," added Sandeep. Sandeep recently bowled against Kohli in PBKS' IPL 2022 opener against RCB.

28.title: Hyd Police extends discount on pending traffic challans till April 15
28.article_body: The Hyderabad Police has extended the deadline for one-time discount on pending traffic challans  till April 15. Earlier, a deadline of March 31 was set for the same. Under the scheme, two-wheelers are given a 75% discount on pending challans, whereas 50% discount is being given to car owners. "Utilise this opportunity and clear your pending challans," Hyderabad Police tweeted.

29.title: Woman arrested for pushing 16-yr-old girl into prostitution in Mumbai
29.article_body: The Anti-Human Trafficking Cell arrested a woman for allegedly pushing a 16-year-old girl into prostitution in Mumbai. The Mira Bhayandar Vasai Virar (MBVV) Police used a decoy customer to trap the accused, who brought the minor to a bus stand outside Mira Road railway station. As soon as the woman accepted â‚¹15,000 in exchange for the service, she was arrested.

30.title: Telangana govt advises citizens to stay indoors from 12-4 pm amid heatwave alert
30.article_body: The Telangana government has advised citizens to stay indoors between 12 pm and 4 pm, in view of the continuous rise in temperature in the state. "The temperature will be high during this time and there are chances of sunstroke," state Director of Public Health G Srinivas Rao said. The IMD has issued an orange alert regarding heatwaves, Rao added.

31.title: Rash driver given bail, told to assist ward boys at TN hospital for 30 days
31.article_body: Madras High Court has granted bail to a man on the condition that he assists ward boys at Government Stanley Hospital in Tamil Nadu's Chennai for 30 days and writes a note on his experience daily. The man is accused of rash driving in an illegal bike racing case. The accused claimed that he was riding pillion and wasn't racing.

32.title: Cong suspends 2 MLAs for violating party's whip, cross-voting in RS elections
32.article_body: The Congress in Assam has suspended two of its MLAs for violating the party's whip and cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha elections. The party suspended its Karimganj South MLA Siddeque Ahmed for writing 'ONE' instead of numeric 1 which led to the cancellation of his vote and also suspended MLA Sashi Kanta Das for voting in favour of BJP.

33.title: Food delivery man held for theft in Mumbai was in jail for 5-yr-old's murder
33.article_body: The Kurar Police had recently arrested a 29-year-old man associated with a food delivery app in relation to theft of e-commerce parcels in Mumbai's Malad. However, on further investigation, the police found out that the man had been convicted in the murder case of a five-year-old boy. The accused was reportedly out on parole when he was arrested.

34.title: Rajkot International Airport expected to be functional by Aug-Sep
34.article_body: The Hirasar Airport or Rajkot Greenfield International Airport is expected to be functional by August or September 2022, the Rajkot District Magistrate said. "There is very good progress in the construction work. About 85% of work on the runway is complete," he added. Located 30 kilometres from the Rajkot industrial city, the airport will cover an area of 1,032 hectares.

35.title: Won't allow Chinese military base, know ramification: Solomon Islands
35.article_body: The Solomon Islands said it'd not allow China to establish a military base in the Pacific islands nation despite its plans to sign a security pact with Beijing. "Government is conscious of the security ramification of hosting a military base, and it'll not be careless to allow such initiative to take place under its watch," PM Manasseh Sogavare's office said.

36.title: I didn't like what I saw, Dhoni was running the whole game: Ajay Jadeja on CSK-LSG match
36.article_body: Talking about CSK's defeat against LSG, former India batter Ajay Jadeja said, "CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja was standing right there, but MS Dhoni continued to run the whole game." He added, "I didn't like what I saw today." Ajay stated, "Dhoni was wrong in taking over today. If Ravindra was even beginning to feel confident about his captaincy...he won't now."

37.title: Sequoia India MD's 15-year-old son builds app for Ukraine refugees to find help
37.article_body: Sequoia India MD GV Ravi Shankar's 15-year-old son Tejas has built an app for Ukrainian refugees in neighbouring countries to get help from locals offering to assist them. He built the app in two weeks. The app includes a map to find closest help locations, verification features based on national IDs across the world and listings offering necessities like food.

38.title: Govt extends AFSPA in 'disturbed areas' of 9 Nagaland and 3 Arunachal districts
38.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Friday issued a notification enlisting nine districts in Nagaland as "disturbed areas", where Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA) will continue to remain imposed for another six months, unless withdrawn earlier. In another notification, the MHA has extended AFSPA in Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap, Changlang and Longding districts from April 1 to September 30.

39.title: Delhi records 2nd highest average minimum temp in March in 72 years
39.article_body: Delhi in 2022 recorded the second-highest average minimum temperature in March in 72 years at 17.6Â°C, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD). From 1951 to 2022, the highest average minimum temperature recorded in March in Delhi was 18.5Â°C in 1953 and 2010, IMD's senior scientist RK Jenamani said. The average maximum temperature in March 2022 was 32.9Â°C.

40.title: BMC plans to build flyover above Goregaon Creek to ease connectivity
40.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has proposed to build a flyover over Goregaon Creek in Mumbai. The flyover is expected to decongest primary arterial roads in the city and help ease connectivity in areas of Oshiwara, Jogeshwari and Andheri East. According to BMC, a portion of slum shanties in Bhagat Singh Nagar will have to be rehabilitated for the project.

41.title: Facebook bug promoted posts with nudity, misinformation for 6 months
41.article_body: A software bug in Facebook led to a heavy distribution of posts containing nudity, violence, and false information reviewed by independent third-party fact-checkers in Feed, over the past six months. Facebook's system also failed to properly demote even Russian state media posts. The technical issue was first introduced in 2019 but didn't create a noticeable impact until October 2021.

42.title: Excise department seizes 8,500 litres of spirit in Kerala; 3 arrested
42.article_body: Three people were arrested after the excise department seized 8,500 litres of spirit from Kalamassery and Edayar areas in Kerala's Ernakulam. They recovered 243 cans of spirit from a small truck and underground cabin of a paint manufacturing company. One of the accused traded spirit under the guise of the paint and biodiesel industry, an excise department official said.

43.title: Fire destroys over 20 homes in Srinagar; 37 families left homeless
43.article_body: A massive fire that broke out in Srinagar's Noor Bagh has destroyed over 20 houses and buildings and left at least 37 families homeless, officials said. The fire had erupted on Wednesday night and four people, including a firefighter, who were injured in the incident have been hospitalised. Essential assistance along with â‚¹1.85 lakh has been given to the families.

44.title: Salman Khan is the biggest action star in India: 'RRR' actor Jr NTR
44.article_body: Jr NTR, in an interview, said that Salman Khan is "the biggest action star in the country". "I've been his fan for a very long time," he added. Talking about how Salman supported 'RRR' by appearing at the film's launch event, he said, "It was so sweet of him...A star of that stature. We're like youngsters in front of him."

45.title: Kohli, Rohit don't like getting out to bowlers part of Team India: Ashwin
45.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin said he enjoys competing against Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the IPL, as they don't like being dismissed by bowlers who are a part of Team India. Talking about his former franchise CSK, Ashwin stated he believes that the dressing room continues to be magical and midas due to the presence of MS Dhoni.

46.title: BJP creating poisonous atmosphere through 'The Kashmir..': Pawar
46.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday accused BJP of creating a "poisonous atmosphere" by spreading "false propaganda" about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits through the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. He said that such a movie "shouldn't have been cleared for screening", but is given tax concessions. "Pakistan-based terror groups were responsible for...attacks on Kashmiri Pandits and Muslims," he added.

47.title: Dead bodies of man, woman found in well in Rajasthan village
47.article_body: Dead bodies of a man and woman were found in a well on Thursday in Raipura village in Rajasthan, police said. The dead body of the man was said to be around 10 days old, police added. Only a skeleton was left of the woman, who was speculated to have died two-three months ago, police further said.

48.title: BMC approves pre-monsoon work of â‚¹545 crore for Mumbai
48.article_body: In a move to prepare Mumbai for the monsoon, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) approved proposals worth â‚¹545 crore. Out of the total amount, â‚¹162 crore are for desilting of stormwater drains and â‚¹383 crore are for reinstating trenches along roads. BMC shared the information after BJP criticised it saying that contractors will have less time to complete pre-monsoon work.

49.title: India reports 1,335 new COVID-19 cases, active cases fall to 13,672
49.article_body: India has reported 1,335 new COVID-19 cases and 52 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 1,225 cases and 28 deaths. The country's active cases have declined to 13,672, while COVID-19 death toll reached 5,21,181. Over 1,900 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours.

50.title: 9 members of wedding procession killed, 4 injured as SUV falls into gorge in J&K
50.article_body: Nine members of a wedding procession died and four others were injured after the SUV they were travelling in fell into a deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Thursday evening. "The vehicle was overloaded beyond its authorised capacity of seven. Prima facie, it appears that the vehicle carrying 13 people was being driven negligently," a police officer said.

51.title: I don't have dementia, Ranbir is entitled to say what he wants: Randhir Kapoor
51.article_body: After Ranbir Kapoor said in a recent interview that his uncle Randhir Kapoor is in an early stage of dementia, the veteran actor said that he doesn't have dementia. "I am perfectly fine. I just had COVID-19 sometime ago." On being asked why Ranbir said it, Randhir replied, "It's Ranbir's wish. He is entitled to say what he wants."

52.title: LPG cylinder for commercial use gets costlier by â‚¹250 from today
52.article_body: The price of commercial LPG cylinders has been hiked by â‚¹250 with effect from today. With the latest hike, a 19-kg commercial cylinder will now cost â‚¹2,253 in Delhi, â‚¹2,205 in Mumbai, â‚¹2,351.5 in Kolkata and â‚¹2,406 in Chennai. However, the domestic LPG cylinder rates and petrol and diesel prices were kept unchanged on Friday.

53.title: Kyiv not Kiev, reject outdated Soviet spelling of our cities: Ukraine Prez
53.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the correct spelling of the country's capital is "Kyiv" and "not Kiev". "[It's] high time to finally discard the outdated Soviet spelling of our cities and adopt the correct Ukrainian form," he said. Zelenskyy thanked Japan's government for deciding to refer to the Ukrainian capital as "Kiiu", the Japanese transliteration of the Ukrainian spelling "Kyiv".

54.title: Sanders compares Bezos & Musk's 'joy rides to space' to oligarchy, video goes viral
54.article_body: US Senator Bernie Sanders in a recent speech said, "Anyone who thinks we don't have...oligarchy right here in America is sorely mistaken." "Multi-billionaires like Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, Richard Branson are off taking joy rides on their rocket ships to outer space," he added. "They're buying $500 million superyachts. And we talk about the yachts...Putin's friends have," Sanders stated.

55.title: I've not met anyone who said it's a bad film: Abhishek on Kashmir Files
55.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan has said 'The Kashmir Files' has worked at the box office because it's a good film. "If [it] wasn't good, it wouldn't have worked," he said. Abhishek, however, added that he hasn't seen the film yet. "But I've not met anybody who said it's a bad film...If a film does good business, it has to be...good," he stated.

56.title: UP CM directs officials to give govt jobs to 10,000 youths in 100 days
56.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed the state service selection boards to give government jobs to more than 10,000 youths in the next 100 days. "UP government is committed to connecting youths with government jobs...providing them employment," Adityanath said. "CM directed officials to explore the use of technology...reduce paper leak incidents to almost nil," an official said.

57.title: Mumbai Police officer booked for not submitting documents in 5 cases
57.article_body: A case has been registered by Mumbai's Kasturba Marg Police against one of its own officers for not submitting documents related to five cases. The accused Anil Sonavane is wanted in a robbery case. From 2015-2016, he was given the charge of an investigating officer in cases related to theft, child labour, unlawful labour, rash driving and road accidents.

58.title: US warned firms about Russia's Kaspersky day after invasion: Report
58.article_body: The US government started privately warning some firms that Russia could manipulate Kaspersky's software to cause harm, the day after Russian invasion, Reuters reported. The US fears Kaspersky's Russian staff could be coerced into helping establish remote access to their users' computers. Kaspersky said briefings about purported risks of its software would be "further damaging" to its reputation.

59.title: International flight departures from B'luru increases from 10 to 25
59.article_body: The Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) in Bengaluru has increased the international flight departure from 10 flights each day to 25 after the government removed restrictions on international flights. Currently, 24 airlines operate to 21 international destinations  in 17 countries from KIA. Before COVID-19 pandemic, there used to be 40 international departures each day from Bengaluru.

60.title: Kharar man kills wife, dumps her body in a canal; arrested
60.article_body: A man from Punjab's Kharar was arrested for allegedly killing his wife and dumping her body in a canal near Morinda. The woman went missing on March 9, following which her sister had filed a missing person's report. During interrogation, the accused confessed to have killed his wife after she confronted him about his extra-marital affair with a Ludhiana-based woman.

61.title: UP police threaten to raze 2 rape accused's houses with bulldozer
61.article_body: Uttar Pradesh police on Thursday threatened two rape accused, saying that they'll raze their houses if the duo doesn't surrender within 24 hours. The duo, who're both from Saharanpur's Chilkana village, had raped a minor girl a week ago and were absconding, a senior police official said. Police had made the threat after reaching the accused's houses with a bulldozer.

62.title: Hyderabad Metro to offer unlimited travel with holiday card for â‚¹59 from April 2
62.article_body: Hyderabad Metro is going to launch a Super Saver Metro Holiday Card from Ugadi on April 2, which offers unlimited travel across 57 stations and three corridors on 100 days including Sundays, second and fourth Saturdays and government holidays. Passengers can buy the card from any ticket counter by paying a non-refundable cost of â‚¹50 and top-up value of â‚¹59.

63.title: UP man awarded 10-yr jail for raping minor niece in Mohali
63.article_body: Mohali's local court sentenced an Uttar Pradesh-based man to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping his niece in May 2015. The convict had raped the minor, studying in class six when she was alone at her home. He also threatened her against speaking up. But she raised an alarm when he made another rape bid the next day.

64.title: LSG's Ayush Badoni's six hits female spectator's head, video goes viral
64.article_body: A video has gone viral showing LSG's Ayush Badoni's 85-metre six on the bowling of CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube hitting a female spectator's head in the stands. In the video, the woman can be seen trying to catch the ball before getting hit on the head. Badoni had hit the six on the first ball of the 19th over.

65.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested in separate cases in Hyderabad
65.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday arrested two drug peddlers and seized eight grams of Dimethyltryptamine (DMT) drug, six LSD blots, 10 ecstasy pills and 100 grams of hash oil from the accused. One of the accused, who used to extract the drug at his residence, was arrested from Jubilee Hills area, police said. While another was arrested from Nallakunta, police added.

66.title: Sri Lanka imposes curfew after protests outside Prez's home turn violent
66.article_body: Police imposed an overnight curfew in several parts of the Sri Lankan capital Colombo as protests outside President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's home, demanding his resignation over the nation's worst economic crisis, turned violent. Police fired tear gas and a water cannon to disperse protesters who blamed Rajapaksa for long power outages and shortages of essentials. "Gota go home," protesters chanted.

67.title: Helmets compulsory for school, college students and govt employees: Pune Collector
67.article_body: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has made it compulsory for school and college students and government employees to wear helmets while riding two-wheelers and commuting to offices or elsewhere. Those found violating the order will face action. "The likelihood of a two-wheeler rider dying in an accident is seven times higher than those travelling in a car," the order stated.

68.title: 3 members of interstate gang arrested after shootout in central Delhi
68.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three members of an interstate gang led by jailed gangsters Lawrence Bishnoi and Virender Pratap alias Kala Rana following a shootout in central Delhi on Thursday evening. The arrested men had come to Delhi from Chandigarh to extort someone, police said. They were involved in several criminal cases in Bihar, Haryana and Punjab, police added.

69.title: LSG's Ayush Badoni's six hits female spectator's head, video goes viral
69.article_body: A video has gone viral showing LSG's Ayush Badoni's 85-metre six on the bowling of CSK fast bowler Mukesh Choudhary hitting a female spectator's head in the stands. In the video, the woman can be seen trying to catch the ball before getting hit on the head. Badoni had hit the six on the first ball of the last over.

70.title: Gurugram witnesses hottest day in March in over 23 years at 41.4Â°C
70.article_body: Gurugram on Thursday witnessed its hottest day in March in over 23 years at 41.4Â°C, as per the India Meteorological Department (IMD) data. Gurugram had recorded the highest maximum temperature of 39.5Â°C in the month of March in 1999. The maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 44Â°C by April 3, according to IMD's weekly forecast.

71.title: Gambhir catches up with Dhoni after CSK-LSG match, pics go viral
71.article_body: Pictures of Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) mentor Gautam Gambhir meeting former Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni following their teams' IPL 2022 match on Thursday have gone viral. Reacting to the photos, a social media user commented, "Haters will say it's photoshopped." "Two legends in one frame," wrote another. Gambhir had recently rubbished claims that he doesn't like Dhoni.

72.title: Putin's approval rating in Russia surges since start of war, hits 83%
72.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's approval rating among Russians has surged since the start of the war in Ukraine, hitting the highest level since September 2017. A poll by the independent Moscow-based Levada Center found 83% of Russians support Putin's activities as President even as he was widely criticised globally. Meanwhile, 15% of the 1,632 Russians polled didn't support Putin's actions.

73.title: Mumbai very likely to experience above-normal temperatures in April: IMD
73.article_body: As per IMD's extended range forecast for the month of April, Mumbai is very likely to experience above-normal temperatures during the next four weeks. IMD's forecast states Mumbai and its surrounding areas may receive some pre-monsoon showers in April. The daytime temperature could rise to 37Â°C by April 2. The maximum temperature in Santacruz was recorded at 32.6Â°C on Thursday.

74.title: Bengaluru police arrest 2 Nigerian nationals, seize â‚¹20 lakh-MDMA
74.article_body: Bengaluru police's Central Crime Branch has arrested two Nigerian nationals for alleged drug peddling and seized MDMA worth â‚¹20 lakh from them, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) tweeted on Thursday. The arrest was made within Banasawadi police station limits. Earlier, police had arrested a drug peddler and seized MDMA and a phone worth a total of â‚¹1.5 lakh.

75.title: Fire breaks out at Pune godown; 4 including 2 firefighters injured
75.article_body: Four people, including at least two firefighters, were injured after a fire broke out at a godown in Pune's Nana Peth on Thursday. At least 12 fire tenders and five ambulances were rushed to the spot after the fire department received a call about the blaze at 11.35 pm. The fire was brought under control around 1 am on Friday.

76.title: 14-yr-old girl, her brother killed after truck hits their bike in Pune
76.article_body: A 14-year-old girl and her 12-year-old brother were killed after a pickup truck allegedly hit their bike near Daund town in the Pune district on Thursday. Officials said the accident took place in the morning when the brother-sister duo were going to their school, adding that the girl was riding the bike. Meanwhile, police have booked the pickup truck driver.

77.title: 23-yr-old BTech graduate dies of alleged drug overdose in Hyderabad
77.article_body: A 23-year-old BTech graduate died of an alleged drug overdose in Hyderabad, police said. Doctors reportedly said that he suffered with multiple sclerosis and strokes and due to drug overdose he died. According to police, the deceased along with a drug-peddler used to frequently visit Goa and consumed multiple drugs like LSD and MDMA. Meanwhile, police have arrested the peddler.

78.title: Banks' consortium releases â‚¹150 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
78.article_body: The first instalment of â‚¹150 crore has been released by a consortium of seven banks for completion of stalled Amrapali projects in the NCR. The consortium will be disbursing a total sum of â‚¹1,500 crore for the construction of over 5,100 units in Amrapali projects in Noida and Greater Noida. Nearly 40,000 homebuyers are awaiting possession in the projects.

79.title: Free Stays or a prank? This April Foolsâ€™ Day, find out on app: Goibibo
79.article_body: Goibibo announced that on April 1, when the world expects to be pranked, it has come up with a fun activation to give 'FULL VASOOL' to its consumers. Users can choose a hotel on the app and apply code 'NOFOOL' to find out what's in store for them. Goibibo added that it's seeing many netizens participating in this activation already.

80.title: Airtel offers transparency at a time when customers need it most: Airtel
80.article_body: Airtel aims to reinforce its commitment to honesty and transparency towards its customers. The telco has started sending messages for planned outages, upgradation and resolutions, making it easier for users to deal with network disruptions and plan their schedules accordingly, it revealed. Airtel seeks to prioritise its customers' needs by keeping them informed and improving their experience.

81.title: Anup Soni shares edited video of Crime Patrol after Will Smith's slap at Oscars
81.article_body: Actor Anup Soni took to Twitter to share a viral video meme on Will Smith's slap at Oscars featuring a clip from 'Crime Patrol'. "I knew this will happen," Soni said. In the video, one could see Smith slapping Chris Rock after which Soni's 'Satark rahiye' dialogue is played. "This is universal. Fits everywhere," a user wrote.

82.title: England defeat SA by 137 runs to reach Women's World Cup final for 2nd straight time
82.article_body: England defeated South Africa by 137 runs in the second semi-final to reach Women's World Cup final for the second straight time. Danielle Wyatt top-scored for England with 129 as her team posted a total of 293-8. South Africa were bowled out for 156 with Sophie Ecclestone registering figures of 8-0-36-6.

83.title: Dwayne Bravo becomes highest wicket-taker in IPL history
83.article_body: CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo has become the highest wicket-taker in IPL history. The 38-year-old achieved the feat by taking his tally of wickets in IPL to 171 after dismissing LSG's Deepak Hooda in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. He overtook the previous record held by Lasith Malinga, who had taken 170 wickets in 122 IPL matches.

84.title: CSK lose first 2 matches of an IPL season for 1st time as LSG chase down 211-run target
84.article_body: LSG defeated CSK by six wickets to register their first victory in IPL 2022. LSG recorded the highest successful run chase in IPL 2022 so far by chasing down 211-run target in 19.3 overs. CSK have now lost first two matches of an IPL season for the first time in history. Quinton de Kock top-scored for LSG with 61(45).

85.title: Pakistan record their highest successful chase in ODI cricket history
85.article_body: Pakistan chased down 349-run target in the second ODI against Australia to register their highest successful chase in ODI history and level the three-match series 1-1. Pakistan captain Babar Azam and opener Imam-ul-Haq slammed hundreds in the match. Pakistan's previous highest successful ODI run chase had come on March 4, 2014, when they chased down a 327-run target against Bangladesh.

86.title: Masked burglar breaks into David Beckham's London mansion while the family was inside
86.article_body: A masked burglar broke into David Beckham's west London mansion while David, Victoria Beckham and their 10-year-old daughter Harper were inside. The burglar ran off with thousands of pounds of designer goods, The Sun reported. Beckham's 17-year-old son Cruz discovered that their house had been burgled when he arrived back home from a night out with friends, the report added.

87.title: Independent foreign policy doesn't mean being anti-India: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
87.article_body: During his address to the nation, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan said an independent foreign policy doesn't mean being anti-India. He stated, "I decided that my foreign policy will be independent. An independent foreign policy is one which is meant for Pakistanis. It doesn't mean we are anyone's enemies. It doesn't mean we will be anti-Americans, anti-India or anti-European."

88.title: Will play till last ball, won't accept defeat: Pak PM ahead of no-confidence motion
88.article_body: Ahead of the no-confidence motion, Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Thursday hinted he won't resign. "People saying Imran...will resign. If you know me from my cricket days, I'm not the one to accept defeat. I'll fight till the last ball," the former Pakistan cricket team captain said. He said he'll come back stronger regardless of the outcome of Sunday's vote.

89.title: Future Retail CEO Sadashiv Nayak resigns after 7 months of his appointment
89.article_body: Future Retail's CEO Sadashiv Nayak has resigned from his role, more than seven months after taking up the role. Nayak has been with Future Group for around 18 years and had been appointed CEO in August 2021. This comes amid Future Retail's legal battle with US e-commerce giant Amazon over a $3.4-billion sale of its retail assets to Reliance Industries.

90.title: The whole movie is beautifully made: Srinidhi Shetty on KGF 1
90.article_body: In an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla, actress Srinidhi Shetty said she felt pressure after the release of KGF: Part 1. "The whole movie is beautifully made," she said. She further said doing the movie was a "conscious decision and equally a risk," adding, "People who started with me in 2016, have already done 10 movies...so it does affect a...bit."

91.title: Don't want gifts, please feed stray animals instead: Rupali Ganguly
91.article_body: Television actress Rupali Ganguly ahead of her birthday on April 5 made a request to her followers and fans on Instagram. She went live on the social media platform and said, "Instead of sending birthday gifts to me...please feed stray animals that would come as...direct blessing to me." She added, "Please help me in fulfilling my dream of creating...animal shelter."

92.title: Comedian Bharti Singh rejects rumours of being blessed with a girl
92.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh recently quashed rumours claiming that she has given birth to a baby girl. She said, "It's not true. I am on...sets of Khatra Khatra. There was a break for 15-20 minutes. So, I decided to come live and clarify that I'm still working." She asked her fans to wait for her to announce the big news.

93.title: It was so difficult: Vidya on having to 'throw a baby' in 'Abhay 3'
93.article_body: Actress Vidya Malavade while recalling her experience on the sets of her upcoming web show 'Abhay 3' said she had to throw a baby for her introduction scene. "I was like 'My goodness! What are you making me do?' It was so difficult," she said. She called the baby cute while adding that she plays the role of a sorceress.

94.title: David, Victoria Beckham's London mansion robbed while they slept
94.article_body: David Beckham and Victoria Beckham's London mansion has reportedly been robbed. As per a report, the couple was said to be inside the house with their 10-year-old daughter Harper when the incident took place. They were reportedly unaware of the thief, who is said to have escaped with thousands of pounds of designer and electric goods from the house.

95.title: Eighth Russian Colonel Kurilo killed in Kharkiv: Ukraine
95.article_body: The Ukrainian military said an eighth Russian colonel has been killed since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. They said Colonel Denis Kurilo was "liquidated" by Ukrainian forces during fighting near Kharkiv. Western officials say around 20 Russian generals have been deployed to Ukraine. Kurilo was in charge of the 200th separate motorised rifle brigade.

96.title: Over 40 Indians still in Ukraine, only few want to return: Minister
96.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs of India Meenakashi Lekhi on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that around 40-50 Indians are still stuck in Ukraine. In a written response to a question on the number of people evacuated, she said that 22,500 Indians have returned and while 40-50 are still stuck, only a few are willing to return.

97.title: Stop all trade with Russia: Ukraineâ€™s Zelenskyy to Dutch Parliament
97.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday addressed the Dutch Parliament, asking them to stop all trade with Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. "Stronger sanctions are needed so that Russia doesn't have a chance to pursue this war further in Europe," he said. The Netherlands has supplied Ukraine with military equipment including Patriot air defence systems and anti-tank rockets.

98.title: We will fight for every metre of our land: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
98.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said Ukrainian troops will "fight for every metre of our land, for every person" amid Russia's invasion which began on February 24. "There is an accumulation of Russian troops for new strikes in Donbas and we are preparing for this," he said. Over 10,000 Russian soldiers have reportedly been killed so far in Ukraine.

99.title: Remove parts that hurt Brahmin sentiments: Kâ€™taka textbook panel
99.article_body: The school textbook review committee set up by the Karnataka government has said that content "hurting Brahmin sentiment" should be removed. The introductory part of chapter six in the class 8 social sciences textbook blames the Vedic way of life for the rise of religions like Jainism and Buddhism in India, said the head of the review committee, Rohith Chakrathirtha.

100.title: I have struggled mentally and emotionally for a long time: F1â€™s Hamilton
100.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said he has struggled mentally and emotionally for a long time, saying it is "hard some days to stay positive." Hamilton finished third and tenth for Mercedes in the opening two races of the season in Bahrain and Saudi Arabia respectively. "We have so much to do and to achieve," he said.

101.title: Premier League clubs vote to allow 5 substitutions from next season
101.article_body: Premier League clubs on Thursday voted to allow five substitutions from next season. Substitutions were increased from three temporarily in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. However, the Premier League decided against changing the rule permanently for the 2020/21 campaign. The Premier League also confirmed the 2022 summer transfer window will open on June 10 and close on September 1.

102.title: Man in New Zealand jailed for threatening to kill PM Jacinda Ardern
102.article_body: A man in New Zealand on Thursday was sentenced to one year in prison for threatening to kill Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern. Prosecutors said Michael Cruickshank, 56, sent 88 emails between 2019 and 2020 to government officials calling them slave-traders, criminals and state-sponsored terrorists. In one email that he sent in January 2020, Cruickshank threatened to blow Ardern's head off.

103.title: 1 killed, 2 injured after US Navy plane crashes off Eastern coast
103.article_body: One person was killed while two others were injured on Wednesday after a US Navy plane crashed in waters near the eastern shore boundary of Virginia and Maryland. The Navy said the deceased crew member was found dead in the aircraft while the other two crew members were rescued by Maryland state police. Officials said they had broken legs.

104.title: Shaheen is a great bowler, I learn a lot from him: Pak bowling coach Tait
104.article_body: Calling Shaheen Shah Afridi "mature and skillful" for his age, Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait said the 21-year-old pacer is a "great bowler". He added, "Shaheen asks a lot of questions. So far, I've enjoyed my time with him and I actually learned a lot from him." Shaheen registered bowling figures of 24.3-3-79-4 in Australia's first innings of third Test.

105.title: Will suggest President to impose Article 355 in WB: Cong leader
105.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Tuesday said that he will meet the President of India over Birbhum violence and will suggest that he considers imposing Article 355 in West Bengal. Chowdhury further said that the special investigation team (SIT) that is probing the matter is of "no use". "Law and order situation is getting worse," he added.

106.title: Not a big fan of pink-ball cricket: Mohammed Azharuddin
106.article_body: Ex-India skipper Mohammed Azharuddin said he's not a big fan of pink-ball cricket (Day-Night Tests). "With Tests, it has to be with...red ball. It's a long-standing tradition and should be upheld in my opinion," he explained. "I know it's getting results, but bowlers and batters have had complaints too in...past," he added. India have three wins from four pink-ball Tests.

107.title: Greek Foreign Minister to personally lead aid mission to Mariupol
107.article_body: Greek Foreign Minister Nikos Dendias said he intends to personally lead a humanitarian aid mission to Ukraine's Mariupol where thousands of ethnic Greeks live. He added that Greece's priority was to protect unarmed civilians and ethnic Greeks in Mariupol. The Greek government said at least 10 ethnic Greeks have been killed, while over 150 Greek citizens have been evacuated.

108.title: Filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola receives Hollywood Walk of Fame star
108.article_body: Filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola has been honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star on Monday. 'The Godfather' trilogy, 'Apocalypse Now', 'The Outsiders' and 'Bram Stoker's Dracula' are among Francis' notable works. Francis is the 2,715th celebrity to receive the star. The ceremony was attended by actresses Elle Fanning and Talia Shire.

109.title: Staff strikes cause cancellations, delays at 8 German airports
109.article_body: Security staff at eight German airports including Frankfurt on Tuesday went on strike over pay issues, causing widespread cancellations and delays. The strikes, called by the German workers' union ver.di, followed walkouts at several German airports last week. Over 100 of the 790 scheduled flights at Frankfurt were cancelled by Tuesday morning. All 88 flights scheduled at Hamburg were cancelled.

110.title: Whole country will be very closely watching Hardik in IPL 2022: Shastri
110.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said the whole country would be watching Hardik Pandya "very closely" in IPL 2022. Hardik will be leading Gujarat Titans as the new franchise debuts in the T20 league. Due to a lower back injury, the India all-rounder is yet to play any competitive match post 2020 T20 World Cup in the UAE.

111.title: Egypt, UAE & Israel leaders meet for 1st ever three-way summit
111.article_body: Leaders of Egypt, Israel and UAE met in Sharm El-Sheikh in a first-ever three-way summit since UAE normalised relations with Israel in 2020. Discussions on energy market stability and food security amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine were held at the meeting. Israeli PM Naftali Bennett's office said the countries focussed on strengthening ties on all levels.

112.title: Sorry to say, Muslim nations didn't do anything to check Islamophobia: Imran Khan
112.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Tuesday said Islamophobia grew after the 9/11 terror attacks, adding, "The reason was- I'm sorry to say- we the Muslim countries didn't do anything to check [it]." He said, "I've spent a lot of my life in England, touring all over the world as a...sportsman. I understand western civilisation probably much better than most people."

113.title: He is greatest batter I've seen in my era: Khawaja on Steve Smith
113.article_body: Following Steve Smith's third consecutive half-century in ongoing three-match Test series against Pakistan, Usman Khawaja said the 32-year-old Australian is greatest batter for him he's seen in his era, averaging 60 throughout his whole Test career. "He seems to be getting 70, 80 [in] every game...doing it very easily," he added. Smith scored 169-ball 59 in third Test in Lahore.

114.title: Must continue monitoring Musk's tweets: US SEC
114.article_body: US SEC on Tuesday urged a federal US judge to not let Tesla CEO Elon Musk escape a 2018 agreement requiring supervision of Musk's Twitter use. The securities regulator said Musk had not met his "high burden" for the agreement to be terminated. "When it comes to civil settlements, a deal is a deal," SEC added.

115.title: Free Wi-Fi available at 6,100 railway stations across India: RailTel
115.article_body: The high-speed free Wi-Fi internet facility has now become available at 6,100 railway stations across the country, RailTel said on Tuesday. "RailTel is at the forefront of National Digital Transformation activities. The Wi-Fi internet facility at stations has become quite popular and useful, especially at stations situated in rural areas," said Puneet Chawla, Chairman & Managing Director, RailTel.

116.title: Spanish truckers' strike continues as 3 unions reject govt aid
116.article_body: Three Spanish truckers' unions on Tuesday rejected a government aid package of â‚¬500 million and joined an ongoing protest by Spanish truck drivers against rising fuel costs. The ongoing strike has disrupted food supply chains in supermarkets across Spain. Transport Minister Raquel Sanchez on Tuesday said the government was considering a reduction in general fuel prices.

117.title: Pakistan Air Force aircraft crashes near Peshawar, 2 pilots killed
117.article_body: Two pilots of the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) were killed after a trainer aircraft crashed near Peshawar during a routine training mission on Tuesday, according to an official statement. No loss of life or property was reported on the ground, it said. "A board of inquiry has been constituted by...Air Headquarters to determine the cause of the incident," it added.

118.title: Uproar in Raj Assembly as Sec 144 imposed in Kota over 'Kashmir Files'
118.article_body: Rajasthan Assembly witnessed an uproar on Tuesday after Section 144 was imposed in Kota till April 21 in view of 'The Kashmir Files' screening. "What kind of an order has been issued...Is the...administration incapable to handle law and order?" asked BJP MLA Sandeep Sharma. Several BJP MLAs supported the issue. The administration clarified there's no ban on watching the film.

119.title: Indian roads will be like America's before December 2024: Nitin Gadkari
119.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday quoted former US President John F Kennedy to say, "American roads are not good because America is rich but America is rich because American roads are good." Speaking in Lok Sabha, Gadkari added, "I want to assure this House that before December 2024, India's road infrastructure will be like America's."

120.title: Model calls out US photographer for charging $100 extra to shoot plus-size models
120.article_body: A 24-year-old model shared a screenshot of a mail wherein a US-based photographer has charged $100 more for photoshoot of plus-size models. A response that she received from William Lords stated the price to shoot a "standard" model was $950 and for the "plus-sized/curve" model was $1050. Meanwhile, a user commented on her post, "Glad this is being called out."

121.title: Congress kept nation safe, BJP wants to divide: Mehbooba Mufti
121.article_body: Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday accused the BJP of "wanting to divide the nation" and "make many Pakistans" while saying that Congress kept the nation safe during its rule. She further said BJP wants the fight with Pakistan to prevail while addressing a public meeting. "My father's uncles...cousins were killed. We want...violence to stop," she added.

122.title: Elon Musk dances at the opening of Tesla's German factory; video surfaces
122.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk was seen dancing in a video after delivering Tesla's first German-made cars to 30 clients and their families at the company's GrÃ¼nheide plant on Tuesday. The deliveries marked the start of Tesla's inaugural European hub just two years after it was first announced. "This is a great day for the factory," Musk said.

123.title: Former Grand Slam champion Becker stands trial over debt settlements
123.article_body: Former Grand Slam champion Boris Becker on Monday stood trial after being accused of failing to hand over several trophies to settle debts. Becker is said to have failed to hand over trophies, including the 1985 Wimbledon men's singles trophy he won at the age of 17, and removing hundreds of thousands of pounds by transferring it to other accounts.

124.title: Tamil Nadu is committed to banning online gambling: Law Minister
124.article_body: Tamil Nadu Law Minister S. Regupathy on Tuesday said that the state is committed to banning online gambling, adding that efforts are on to invoke the existing laws to achieve the purpose. He further said that the previous AIADMK government had promoted an ordinance to ban online gambling "in a hurry", leading to the Madras High Court quashing it.

125.title: Cyclist's gold chain worth â‚¹45,000 snatched by biker in Mumbai
125.article_body: A biker attacked a 30-year-old man and snatched his gold chain valued at â‚¹45,000 near Khar in Mumbai. The incident took place at around 10.30 pm on Sunday when the victim was riding his cycle, following which the accused managed to run away from the scene. According to reports, the bike's number plate was concealed with a sticker.

126.title: Gender is taught concept that I don't relate to: Konkona Sensharma
126.article_body: Konkona Sensharma said she doesn't view herself as a woman. "I see myself as being completely neutral. Gender is a taught concept that I don't relate to," she added. Konkana further said that there's no particular way of being a woman or a man. "When I have to be...feminine in a film, I've to learn how to," she stated.

127.title: 56-yr-old Thane man allegedly sexually assaults 17-yr-old; held
127.article_body: Police have arrested a 56-year-old businessman in Thane, Maharashtra, for allegedly sexually assaulting a 17-year-old girl. The accused, identified as Shrinath Waghole, was found to be the business partner of the victim's father during investigation. Police said a case was registered under relevant sections of the IPC and POCSO after the victim narrated the incident to her father.

128.title: Maha govt suspends DCP Saurabh Tripathi over angadia extortion case
128.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Tuesday suspended Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Saurabh Tripathi, who is wanted in the angadia extortion case in Mumbai. The suspension order stated Tripathi was found absent from duty without any information to the authorities. It was also found that he had been exerting pressure on the witnesses in the FIR registered over the case.

129.title: Haryana MLAs to get â‚¹20,000 as monthly allowance for drivers: CM
129.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced the MLAs from the state will receive a "driver allowance" of â‚¹20,000 per month. This will be in addition to the travel allowance they are being given at the rate of â‚¹18 per kilometre, he said. Khattar made the announcement in the Assembly on the concluding day of the budget session.

130.title: Andhra theatre puts fences near screen expecting huge rush for 'RRR'
130.article_body: A movie theatre in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam has put up barbed wires and fences near the screen ahead of the release of the movie 'RRR', directed by SS Rajamouli, expecting a huge rush. The decision was taken after the screen got damaged due to a huge crowd during screening of 'Pushpa'. 'RRR' stars Alia Bhatt, Jr NTR and Ram Charan.

131.title: Premier League referee Mike Dean set to retire after 22-year career
131.article_body: Premier League referee Mike Dean is set to retire at the end of the current season after a career spanning 22 years. The 53-year-old holds the record for the most Premier League games officiated, 553, most yellow cards, 2,026, and most red cards, 114. Dean also holds the Premier League record for awarding the most penalties with 184.

132.title: I'm slave of Nehru-Gandhi family, will remain one till death: Raj MLA
132.article_body: Rajasthan MLA Sanyam Lodha on Tuesday described himself as a "slave" of the Nehru-Gandhi family, adding that he'll remain one until his death. "We'll keep doing slavery of the Gandhi-Nehru family as [they]...led the development in [India]," he added. Lodha, who is an independent MLA from Sirohi, made the statement in state Assembly in response to a BJP legislator's remark.

133.title: Vodafone Idea blocks 8,000 SIM cards after MP police notice: Report
133.article_body: Vodafone Idea has reportedly blocked nearly 8,000 SIM cards after MP's cyber police directed various telecom companies to block SIM cards issued on fake identity proofs. This comes after the team found that fraudsters allegedly used 20,000 different numbers to cheat people by calling them using these SIM cards. Other telecom companies will re-verify their records to block such cards.

134.title: Rape accused who tried to escape from custody shot at by Assam Police
134.article_body: A 54-year-old man, accused of raping two minor sisters, aged eight and five, was shot at by police after he allegedly tried to escape from custody in Assam's Karbi Anglong district. A senior officer claimed on Tuesday that the accused was absconding and was apprehended on Monday. He reportedly attempted to escape while being brought to the Kheroni police station.

135.title: Video shows man slamming 20kg weight on gymgoer's head while pretending to fall in Aus
135.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing the moment a man named Ryan slammed 20kg weight on a gymgoer's head while pretending to fall in Australia. Ryan has been jailed for 19 months after he fractured the victim's skull. The video shows the victim doing bench press and then clutching his head in pain after being hit.

136.title: Russia 'kidnapped' over 2,000 children from Ukraine's Donbas: US
136.article_body: The US embassy in Kyiv said that as per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, 2,389 Ukrainian children have been "illegally removed" from the breakaway regions of Luhansk Oblast and Donetsk (Donbas) to Russia. "This is not assistance. It is kidnapping," said the embassy. There has been a significant pro-Russian separatist presence in the Donbas region since 2014.

137.title: 1 lakh civilians waiting to leave besieged Mariupol: Ukraine
137.article_body: At least 1 lakh civilians are waiting to leave besieged Mariupol but could not because of a lack of safe corridors, Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk said on Tuesday. She also said that Russian shelling is preventing rescue workers from accessing the site of a bombed theatre, where hundreds were believed to be sheltering at the time of the airstrike.

138.title: World no. 3 Nadal out for up to six weeks with stress fracture in rib
138.article_body: World number three Rafael Nadal's team on Tuesday said he will be out for up to six weeks after suffering a stress fracture in his rib. Nadal complained of chest problems during his run to the final of the ATP Masters 1000 event in Indian Wells. Nadal was beaten by American Taylor Fritz 3-6, 6-7(5-7) in the final on Sunday.

139.title: Form panel to know truth behind exodus of Kashmiri Pandits: Abdullah
139.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday said that the BJP-led Centre should appoint a commission to know the truth behind the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits in the 1990s. Abdullah had previously alleged that 'The Kashmir Files' was far from reality and nothing but "pure propaganda" to polarise the nation.

140.title: AAP is not yet born in Himachal, our competition is with BJP: Cong
140.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress leaders met the party President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday and discussed over strengthening the party in the state. On the upcoming Assembly election in Himachal Pradesh, the leaders said, "AAP is not yet born in the state...Our competition is with BJP." Notably, AAP had said that it'll contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh elections.

141.title: Constable killed in encounter between terrorists and police in J&K
141.article_body: A constable was killed in an encounter between police and terrorists in Srinagar on Tuesday, Jammu and Kashmir IGP Vijay Kumar informed. The constable, identified as Amir Hussain, was said to have succumbed to his injuries following the shootout, which took place in the Soura area. One terrorist, who belonged to the LeT group, was also injured.

142.title: Military development of islands within China's rights: Official
142.article_body: A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson said that China is well within its right to set up military facilities on the islands it has built in the South China Sea. US military activities in the area aimed to "stir up trouble", the spokesperson added. Notably, the comments come after the US claimed that China has fully militarised at least three islands.

143.title: Paresh was on top of my list while recasting: Farhan on 'Sharmaji...'
143.article_body: Farhan Akhtar said Paresh Rawal's name was on top of his list when they were recasting for 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "I've always been an admirer of his work, and...had the opportunity to work with him," he added. Paresh was roped in for the film after Rishi Kapoor, who was originally cast as the lead in the film, had passed away.

144.title: Spent 30% of Attack's budget on VFX, not on myself: John Abraham
144.article_body: Actor John Abraham, speaking about his upcoming film 'Attack', has said that 30% of the film's budget has been spent on the VFX. "Actor's fee is usually close to 50%...of the entire budget...In our case...we've not spent on John Abraham, we've spent on VFX," he stated. "I'm not in the race of charging the most or the least," he added.

145.title: Netherlands football coach Louis van Gaal tests positive for COVID-19
145.article_body: Netherlands football coach Louis van Gaal on Tuesday tested positive for COVID-19 ahead of two friendly international matches against Denmark and Germany. The Netherlands are three-time World Cup finalists, with Louis van Gaal leading the team to the semi-finals at the 2014 World Cup in Brazil. The Netherlands failed to qualify for the previous World Cup in Russia in 2018.

146.title: Chandigarh declares public holiday on Shaheed Diwas on March 23
146.article_body: The Chandigarh administration on Tuesday announced a public holiday on March 23 on the occasion of Bhagat Singh's death anniversary, also known as Shaheed Diwas. Earlier in the day, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had declared a public holiday on the occasion. Shaheed Diwas also marks the death anniversary of freedom fighters Sukhdev Thapar and Shivaram Rajguru.

147.title: Time to end Russia's "absurd war" in Ukraine: UN Secretary-General
147.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday said it's time to end the "absurd war" started by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Continuing war in Ukraine is morally unacceptable, politically indefensible and militarily nonsensical," he added. UN chief also urged to stop hostilities and called for serious negotiations. Meanwhile, at least 925 civilians were killed in Ukraine till March 20.

148.title: Will dig up & raze your houses if you hit poor: MP CM to criminals
148.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Tuesday that he will "dig up and raze" the houses of criminals if they raise their hand on poor people. Chouhan added that he won't let criminals live in peace. His comments come days after a clash broke out between two communities in the state's Raisen district, which lead to one death.

149.title: Delhi NCR developers plan to halt construction as raw material costs soar
149.article_body: Developers in Delhi NCR are planning to stop purchase of raw materials and construction activity due to rising raw material costs, according to industry body CREDAI NCR. "After COVID-19, the current crisis is a dual blow on real estate developers," said CREDAI NCR President Pankaj Bajaj. CREDAI members in Maharashtra are also planning to stop work for the same reason.

150.title: Dalit woman raped by 8, including 2 DMK members, for 7 months in TN
150.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police has arrested eight persons, including four minors and two DMK members, for allegedly raping a 22-year-old Dalit woman for nearly seven months in Virudhunagar. The main accused, Hariharan Mahendran, filmed his intimate moments with the victim and later showed it to his friends. The accused threatened to leak the videos and raped her repeatedly.

151.title: Video shows Farooq lashing out at media when asked about Kashmiri Pandits
151.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and National Conference veteran Farooq Abdullah was seen in a video lashing out at reporters in Parliament premises on Tuesday when asked about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits in the 1990s. "You (BJP) want to know the truth, you should appoint a commission," he said. When asked another question, he replied, "Don't push me."

152.title: BSE seeks clarification from Paytm's parent company over fall in share price
152.article_body: The BSE has sought a clarification from Paytm's parent company One 97 Communications Ltd over a fall in its share price. It said the clarification is sought to ensure that investors "have latest relevant information about the company and to inform the market". While the issue price of Paytm shares was â‚¹2,150, the price dropped to â‚¹543.90 in Tuesday's trade.

153.title: Rishi ji called me insecure actor on 'Sharmaji Namkeen' sets: Juhi
153.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla has revealed that late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor screamed at her on 'Sharmaji Namkeen' sets because she kept checking the monitor. "Chintu ji was like, 'Monitor is not meant for actors. Why are you behaving like an insecure actor?'" the actress said. Juhi added that she would crack up but still go and see the monitor.

154.title: Playing for â‚¹10 lakh or â‚¹10.75 cr in IPL doesn't matter: RCB's Harshal
154.article_body: RCB pacer Harshal Patel said he's going to play in IPL 2022 "exactly" the same way like he played last year and price tag of â‚¹10 lakh or â‚¹10.75 crore doesn't matter. "No new skills, all I...hope...is (that) I'm more precise in my execution," he added. Harshal was bought back by RCB for â‚¹10.75 crore in IPL mega auction 2022.

155.title: Authentication firm Okta probes report of digital breach
155.article_body: Okta is investigating report of a digital breach on its platform after hackers posted screenshots of what they said was the company's internal information. Okta had detected an attempt to compromise the account of a third party customer support engineer in January and believes this breach to be related, it said. The hackers belonged to ransom-seeking group known as LAPSUS$.

156.title: WhatsApp rolls out message reactions for Android Beta users
156.article_body: WhatsApp is releasing the 'Message Reactions' feature for some users on WhatsApp Beta for Android. Only certain beta testers have received the ability to test the feature which includes six emoji reactions. With another recently announced multi-device update for WhatsApp Web and WhatsApp Desktop, users can access the app on four devices without having the smartphone connected to the internet.

157.title: 21 flights cancelled at Bagdogra Airport due to damage on runway
157.article_body: Flight operations were halted as 21 flights were cancelled at Bagdogra International Airport in West Bengal's Siliguri after the damage was reported on the runway on Tuesday evening, Bagdogra Airport Director P Subramani said. He, however, said the morning operation "was okay as seven flights landed in the morning and five took off". Subramani added flights will operate normally tomorrow.

158.title: Sri Lankan Parliament approves amendments to anti-terrorism law
158.article_body: Sri Lankan Parliament on Tuesday approved amendments to the country's contentious anti-terrorism law. The amendments to the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) will include the reduction in the detention period of the accused and expedited hearing of cases. The law allows authorities to make warrantless searches and arrests if a person is suspected of being involved in terrorist activity.

159.title: UN General Assembly Special Session on Ukraine to resume on Wed
159.article_body: The Emergency Special Session of the UN General Assembly on Ukraine will resume on Wednesday, UNGA President Abdulla Shahid tweeted. The announcement was made after 22 member states, including France and the US, wrote a letter calling for the resumption of the session. A draft resolution sponsored by Ukraine and other member states is being processed, a UN official said.

160.title: I've played for so long, know what to talk: Raina on commentary debut in IPL
160.article_body: Speaking about his commentary debut in upcoming IPL, Suresh Raina said he'll enjoy it and feels it'll be exciting. "I've played for so long, so I know what to talk [about] and where...doing commentary is something I still need to learn. It'll be difficult," he added. Raina went unsold in IPL mega auction in February after being released by CSK.

161.title: Marilyn Monroe painting expected to fetch $200 million at auction
161.article_body: Auction house Christie's on Monday said a portrait of actress Marilyn Monroe by Andy Warhol called "Shot Sage Blue Marilyn" is expected to fetch an estimated record $200 million at auction. Christie's Chairman of 20th and 21st Century Art Alex Rotter said the work "is poised to be the most expensive painting of the 20th century ever sold at auction."

162.title: DMK worker & 4 minors, among 8 held for raping 22-yr-old woman in TN
162.article_body: The Virudhanagar Police on Monday arrested eight persons, including a DMK worker and four minors for allegedly raping a 22-year-old woman and threatening to release the video on social media. DMK leader Kanimozhi Karunanidhi said that it's "consoling" that the accused have been arrested. "Strong action has to be taken against the accused, no matter who they are," she added.

163.title: Pak, China sign 5 agreements to strengthen 'iron-clad friendship'
163.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi and his Pakistani counterpart Shah Mahmood Qureshi signed five bilateral cooperation agreements during a meeting in Pakistan's capital Islamabad on Monday. "Ways to further strengthen the iron-clad friendship between the two countries were discussed," the Pakistani Foreign Office said. Separately, the two ministers also discussed the conflict in Ukraine, it added.

164.title: Video captures moment when a tornado approaches Walmart store in US' Texas
164.article_body: A video has surfaced online that captured the moment when a tornado approached a Walmart store's parking lot in Texas, US on Monday. In the video, people can be seen running to take cover amid high-speed winds. A storm system that passed through Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama has reportedly left at least one person dead and 19 others hospitalised.

165.title: SRK's daughter Suhana, friend hide face inside car as media click pics
165.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana was seen hiding her face along with a friend inside their car while leaving Mannat as media persons clicked pictures on Tuesday. One of the pictures shows her talking to the driver while her friend kept his face hidden with his hand. Suhana will reportedly debut in Zoya Akhtarâ€™s film based on 'Archies' comics.

166.title: Illegally built house of main accused of Shahdol gang-rape destroyed
166.article_body: The illegally built house of the main accused of the gang-rape of a 28-year-old woman in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district was destroyed on Tuesday, following the order of the district administration. According to the police, the woman was raped by three men on Saturday, who later fed her a poisonous substance, which led to her death in a hospital.

167.title: Centre seeks report from West Bengal govt after houses set on fire killing 8
167.article_body: After at least eight people were killed as houses were set on fire in West Bengal's Birbhum, the Centre sought a detailed report on the incident from the state government. Violence was reported from Boktui village after TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh was killed. CM Mamata Banerjee has asked the DGP to take immediate action against perpetrators of the violence.

168.title: Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai buys helicopter costing â‚¹100 crore
168.article_body: Dubai-based Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai, the Chairman of industrial development conglomerate RP Group, has bought an Airbus H145 helicopter costing â‚¹100 crore. The helicopter was delivered by Airbus in Kovalam and took its inaugural flight from Kovalam to The Raviz Ashtamudi. The helicopter is capable of landing and takeoff from even high altitudes of 20,000 feet above sea level.

169.title: BSP's votes shifted to BJP: SP leader on UP Assembly poll results
169.article_body: Reacting to the results of UP Assembly elections, Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Imran Masood alleged that the BJP benefitted from the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP). "It is a 100% fact that the BSP's votes transferred to the BJP," he said. Masood, who resigned from Congress to join SP before the polls, added that elections should be conducted using ballot papers.

170.title: India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage crosses 181.56 crore
170.article_body: The cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 181.56 crore on Tuesday, the Union Health Ministry said. Meanwhile, over 34 lakh children have so far been administered the vaccine against COVID-19, the ministry stated. Notably, India reported 1,581 new COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours. India's daily positivity rate stands at 0.28%.

171.title: Mere breach of contract is not in itself a criminal offence: SC
171.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that a mere breach of contract is not in itself a criminal offence and gives rise to the civil liability of damages. A bench comprising Justices S A Nazeer and Krishna Murari said the distinction between mere breach of contract and cheating, which is a criminal offence, is a fine one.

172.title: Will never impose sanctions against Russia: Serbian minister
172.article_body: Serbian Interior Minister Aleksandar Vulin on Tuesday said government will never impose sanctions against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine. "Serbia will never be part of the anti-Russian hysteria in which property of Russian citizens and property of Russian Federation is stolen..." added Vulin. Serbia is the only European nation that has refused to join international sanctions against Russia.

173.title: Lucknow Super Giants unveil their first jersey and theme song, share video
173.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), who will make their debut in IPL 2022, have unveiled their first jersey and theme song. The KL Rahul-led franchise will don a cyan-coloured jersey. Their theme song 'Ab apni baari hai' has been sung by Badshah, while its video has been directed and choreographed by Remo Dsouza.

174.title: Sonia holds talks with Congress' rebel leaders at her residence
