348.title: Maliâ€™s ex-Prime Minister Soumeylou Maiga dies in detention
348.article_body: Mali's former PM Soumeylou Maiga, arrested over corruption allegations last year, has died due to an undisclosed illness, one of his lawyers said. The 67-year-old died at a clinic in Bamako on Monday, where he'd been hospitalised since December, the lawyer added. Reportedly, the military government had refused his family's request to allow Maiga to travel abroad for treatment.

349.title: 96-year-old World War II Holocaust survivor killed in shelling in Ukraine
349.article_body: A 96-year-old Holocaust survivor, Boris Romanchenko, was killed in Russian shelling in Ukraine. Buchenwald memorial institute said that Romanchenko had survived the Nazi camps at Buchenwald, Peenemunde, Dora and Bergen-Belsen during World War II. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Please think about how many things he has come through but he was killed by a Russian strike."

350.title: Let's see how Umran performs with pressure of expectations in IPL: Jaffer
350.article_body: Talking about Umran Malik, who was retained by SRH for â‚¹4 crore before IPL mega auction 2022,  Wasim Jaffer said it remains to be seen how the 22-year-old pacer performs with pressure of expectations in upcoming IPL. "He's somebody who bowls 150 clicks (kmph)," he added. Umran made his IPL debut last season and took two wickets from three matches.

351.title: Man stalks woman, claims she is a sex worker; arrested in Mumbai
351.article_body: A 58-year-old man, Venu Koli, has been arrested for allegedly stalking and sexually harassing a 38-year-old woman in south Mumbai. The victim said Koli had uploaded a message on his Whatsapp status, claiming that she was a sex worker. She alleged that he got CCTV cameras installed in her residential area and would upload her videos on platforms like YouTube.

352.title: 2 women rescued as Noida Police bust online sex racket; 1 arrested
352.article_body: Noida Police have rescued two women and arrested one person as they busted a sex racket that was being run through online booking, an official said. During interrogation, the accused revealed he used to send women to different houses and hotels after contacting his customers through the internet and WhatsApp. He collected huge amounts of money from the customers daily.

353.title: Rahul Mahajan's ex-wife Dimpy Ganguly announces third pregnancy, shares pic
353.article_body: Rahul Mahajan's ex-wife, model Dimpy Ganguly, announced her third pregnancy. Taking to Instagram, Dimpy shared a photo flaunting her baby bump, in which her two kids can also be seen by her side. She captioned the post, "The most...fulfilling love I've ever experienced is the love I have received from my babies...Can't believe very soon this love will become x3!"

354.title: The Fame Game's Gagan Arora marries longtime girlfriend, shares pics
354.article_body: Actor Gagan Arora, who portrayed Madhav in 'The Fame Game', has announced that he married longtime girlfriend Muditaa last month. Gagan shared pictures from the wedding, writing, "With a lot of restrictions and a very small gathering...we started this new journey." He further wrote that 12 years ago, he looked at Muditaa and told his friends he will marry her.

355.title: We did well to get to 229 after losing 3 wickets in 5 balls vs B'desh: Mithali
355.article_body: After defeating Bangladesh by 110 runs in the Women's ODI World Cup, India captain Mithali Raj said they did well to post the 229-run total despite losing the first three wickets in five balls during their innings. "Having all-rounders definitely gives the cushion of batting deep," she added. India have now won three of their six games in the tournament.

356.title: New batteries for Delhi remote control: Sidhu on AAP's RS nominee choices
356.article_body: Taking a jibe at Aam Aadmi Party's Rajya Sabha nominee choices, Congress leader Navjot Sidhu said, "New batteries for the Delhi remote control, it's blinking... Harbhajan is an exception, the rest are batteries and betrayal of Punjab." Earlier, the AAP party rivals had claimed that Arvind Kejriwal intends to "control" the new Punjab government from the national capital.

357.title: B'luru man slits wife's throat in front of kids, then dies by suicide
357.article_body: Sampath, a 36-year-old factory worker, slit his wife's throat in front of their children and later died by suicide on Monday morning in Bengaluru's Attibele. According to police, the couple got into a fight and Sampath later slit his wife's throat while she was sleeping. He also stabbed one of their minor sons as he moved to help the victim.

358.title: 125-yr-old Padma awardee Swami Sivananda eats oil-free food, wakes up at 3 am
358.article_body: Yoga guru Swami Sivananda who received Padma Shri on Monday had revealed earlier that he eats food that is free of oil and spices and prefers eating rice and boiled daal with some green chillies. The 125-year-old wakes up at 3 am and follows a rigorous daily routine. A video of him kneeling before PM Narendra Modi had gone viral.

359.title: Will run govt transparently, make U'khand best state of India: Dhami
359.article_body: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Tuesday that he'll ensure his administration's work reaches people at the grassroots. "We will run our government in complete transparency and make Uttarakhand the best out of all the states in the country," Dhami added. Dhami, who lost from Khatima Assembly constituency, will take oath as CM for a second term on Wednesday.

360.title: Son no longer named Wolf, we didn't feel like it was him: Kylie Jenner
360.article_body: American reality television personality Kylie Jenner took to Instagram Stories to announce that her son is no longer named Wolf. She wrote, "We just really didn't feel like it was him. Just wanted to share because I keep seeing Wolf everywhere." Her announcement came hours after she shared a YouTube video showing intimate footage leading up to her son's birth.

361.title: Pradeep an inspiration, firmly placed in millions of Indians' hearts: Smriti
361.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani took to Instagram to share post for Pradeep Mehra, a 19-year-old youth, who was spotted running on roads of Noida in a bid to prepare for joining the Indian Army. "Pradeep...a hero...hopeful for a place in the Indian Army now firmly placed in the heart of millions of Indians...an inspiration," read the post by Smriti Irani.

362.title: Faf Du Plessis commands a lot of respect, doesn't demand it: Kohli
362.article_body: Talking about new RCB captain Faf Du Plessis, former RCB captain Virat Kohli said, "Du Plessis commands a lot of respect, does not demand it because he has been there and done that." "I messaged him as soon as he was picked for RCB. It was official after, but I knew obviously," added Kohli.

363.title: To carry the hopes of billions for years was sensational: Lara on Tendulkar
363.article_body: Talking about Sachin Tendulkar, Brian Lara said, "To carry the hopes of billions for...years was sensational. We have always kept in touch, there is mutual respect. What I like the most...is his humility." Lara termed late Australian cricketer Shane Warne as the greatest leg-spinner ever. "Facing him was a challenge. We have been involved in some fascinating duels," added Lara.

364.title: Russia bars its scientists from international conferences
364.article_body: Russian scientists will not participate in international conferences this year, Russia's Ministry of Science and Higher Education said. "We are not calling for abandoning publications in Web of Science and Scopus (academic resources)," Minister Valery Falkov said in a statement. "We need to act in accordance with our national interests," he added.

365.title: ED questions TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee in coal scam case for 8 hrs in Delhi
365.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday questioned TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee at its New Delhi office for nearly eight hours in connection with the coal scam case. Banerjee reached the Central agency's office at around 11 am yesterday and left shortly before 8 pm. He was accompanied by his security personnel and legal team.

366.title: 2 women among 10 arrested for attacking police during Holi in Karnal
366.article_body: At least 10 persons, including two women, were arrested by the Karnal police for allegedly damaging a police vehicle, injuring three police officials and creating ruckus in a government hospital after a clash over Holi celebrations in Karnal. The incident took place during a clash between the two groups during Holi celebrations.

367.title: Doctors told to remove genitals of captured Russians in Ukraine
367.article_body: The owner of a war-zone mobile hospital in Ukraine has instructed his doctors to remove genitals of captured Russian soldiers. "I have always been a great humanist...But now [I gave] very strict orders to castrate all [captured Russian] men, because they are cockroaches, not people," the 49-year-old owner said. Since 2014, around 500 doctors have worked with his mobile hospital.

368.title: Which were the most polluted cities in India and Pakistan in 2021?
368.article_body: India was home to 11 of the 15 most polluted cities in Central and South Asia in 2021, with the remaining four cities being from Pakistan, as per World Air Quality Report. Bhiwadi was the most polluted city in India, followed by Ghaziabad, Delhi and Jaunpur. Faisalabad was the most polluted city in Pakistan, followed by Bahawalpur, Peshawar and Lahore.

369.title: Please stop bothering Pradeep Mehra for interviews: Kapri requests media outlets
369.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri on Monday requested media organisations to stop bothering 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for interviews. Kapri's initial video of Mehra running in Noida at midnight had been widely circulated on social media and received reactions from various celebrities. "You can use my videos without permission...Just let that kid live his life. Stop this spectacle," Kapri added.

370.title: HUL in talks to buy majority stake in MDH at â‚¹10,000 crore-â‚¹15,000 crore valuation: Report
370.article_body: FMCG major Hindustan Unilever Ltd is in discussions to buy a majority stake in MDH Spices, Livemint reported on Tuesday. MDH could be valued between â‚¹10,000 crore and â‚¹15,000 crore, the report added. MDH Spices is said to have been in discussions with other conglomerates too after the demise of Founder Mahashay Dharampal Gulati, who passed away in December 2020.

371.title: It will shake you to core, I cried in 1st meeting: Vipul on 'The Kerala Story'
371.article_body: Sunshine Pictures has announced the movie 'The Kerala Story' based on "true stories of about 32,000 girls and counting". "This story is a human tragedy, one that will shake you to the core. When Sudipto came and narrated it...along with his research of over 3-4 years, I was in tears in the first meeting itself," producer Vipul Shah said.

372.title: Have high hopes for Sarfaraz Khan this time: Wasim Jaffer
372.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he has high hopes for Sarfaraz Khan, who was bought by DC for â‚¹20 lakh. "Sarfaraz has played at number five, six and seven mostly...this year we might get to see him bat at three or four," Jaffer explained. Sarfaraz has scored a total of 33 runs in the last two IPL seasons.

373.title: Russian court finds Putin critic Navalny guilty of fraud
373.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday found President Vladimir Putin's jailed critic Alexey Navalny guilty of fraud and embezzlement charges. Russian prosecutors are seeking to move Navalny to a maximum security prison for 13 years. Navalny called the charges against him "politically motivated". He is currently serving a two-and-a-half-year sentence at a prison camp in Moscow for parole violations.

374.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami to take oath as U'khand CM for 2nd time tomorrow
374.article_body: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami will take oath as the Chief Minister for the second time in Dehradun on Wednesday. The ceremony will be held at 3.30 pm at the Parade Ground. Dhami, who lost from the Khatima seat in the Assembly polls, was elected leader of the BJP legislature party in Uttarakhand on Monday.

375.title: Over 5,000 planets exist beyond our solar system, confirms NASA
375.article_body: NASA confirmed that more than 5,000 planets exist beyond our solar system, representing a 30-year journey of discovery led by NASA space telescopes. The number of confirmed exoplanets crossed the 5,000-mark on March 21, with the latest batch of 65 exoplanets â€“ planets outside our immediate solar family. The 5,000-plus planets found so far include small, rocky worlds like Earth.

376.title: No plans to make Tripura dry state, no proof that prohibition works: Govt
376.article_body: There are no plans to make Tripura a dry state, said Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma on Monday. "There is no scientific evidence that substantiates the claim that a ban on alcohol sales would reduce consumption," he added. The minister said the government is acting against illegal brewers, dealers and stockists of alcohol across the state.

377.title: Ranveer, Jacqueline are class apart when it comes to dancing: Govinda
377.article_body: In a recent interview, when asked who would be perfect to take his and actress Karisma Kapoor's place as a hit on-screen Jodi, actor Govinda replied, "I think today, from the younger crop, Ranveer Singh and Jacqueline Fernandez are both a class apart when it comes to dancing." "I think they would make a great Jodi as well," he added.

378.title: CM Yogi resigns as MLC ahead of oath-taking ceremony on March 25
378.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has tendered his resignation from the UP Legislative Council days after getting elected as an MLA from the Gorakhpur Urban constituency. CM Yogi was elected to the UP Legislative Council soon after becoming the state's CM in 2017. The 49-year-old politician is likely to take oath as CM again during the ceremony on March 25.

379.title: Police officer injured after car hits him in Hyd; video surfaces
379.article_body: A police officer was injured after a BMW car knocked him down on Hyderabad's Tank Bund on Monday. A video of the incident has surfaced online. A police inspector told Telangana Today that the police officer was crossing the road to check something when the car hit him, following which he fell on the car and then on the road.

380.title: Tesla to hand over 1st Model Ys made at its German Gigafactory
380.article_body: Tesla will hand over the first Model Y vehicles made at its German Gigafactory plant to clients on Tuesday. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will attend Tuesday's ceremony alongside Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk. "Excited to hand over the first production cars made by Giga Berlin-Brandenburg," Musk said on Twitter. Tesla plans to hire 12,000 workers for the plant.

381.title: Akhilesh quits as Lok Sabha MP after winning 1st Assembly poll
381.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has resigned as Lok Sabha MP, days after he won his first Assembly poll from Karhal in UP. He had won from Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituency in the 2019 election. With 1,48,196 votes, he defeated his closest rival from BJP, Prof SP Singh Baghel, in Karhal.

382.title: Ex-ABVP chief who urinated in front of woman's home granted bail
382.article_body: Madras High Court on Monday granted interim bail to former ABVP National President Dr Subbiah Shanmugam for allegedly harassing a 62-year-old woman by urinating in front of her house and throwing surgical masks in 2020. The court did so saying that Subbiah was arrested on a public holiday and questioned why the arrest happened "1.5 years after complaint was filed".

383.title: 6 arrested for performing bike stunts on Chennai's Kamarajar Salai
383.article_body: Police have arrested six men who performed dangerous motorcycle stunts on Kamarajar Salai near Marina Beach in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Expensive motorbikes, including those from brands KTM, Yamaha and Activa, have been seized from the bikers. Police said it is illegal to modify bikes and mechanics have been directed to inform police if youngsters ask them to modify their two-wheelers.

384.title: Tiger electrocuted in trap laid for wild boars in MP, 4 arrested
384.article_body: A tiger was electrocuted in a trap laid for wild boars in Balaghat district of Madhya Pradesh, a forest official said on Tuesday. The tiger, about 10 to 12 years old, was found buried under the sand in a forest area near Ratta village, Narendra Sanodia, chief conservator of forest, said. Four people were arrested in connection with the killing.

385.title: Issues of Kashmiri Pandits never came in newspapers: Brahmin group member
385.article_body: BK Premananda Kamath from Kerala, who is a member of the Gaud Saraswat Brahmin community, said 'The Kashmir Files' is a "heart-wrenching" movie. "I remember these issues had never come in the newspapers, except saying that one Hindu was killed and a Pandit was killed...We never knew that so many atrocities had happened to the Hindus back then," he added.

386.title: RR have fantastic attack and I'm here to guide them to deliver their best: Malinga
386.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga, who has been roped by RR as their fast bowling coach, has said the franchise has a fantastic pace attack and he's there to guide the pacers to deliver their best. "[It's a] talented group of bowlers...we've got experienced overseas players like Boult and Coulter-Nile...genuine Indian fast bowlers in Prasidh and Saini," Malinga added.

387.title: T'gana BJP MP slams CM KCR for politicising paddy procurement
387.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao demanded that the Centre buy the entire paddy crop produced in the state, BJP MP D Arvind slammed the former for politicising paddy procurement. "The TRS government has to give around 5,00,000 tonnes of paddy to the Centre, but they're not doing that...instead, Telangana government is black marketing it," the Nizamabad MP added.

388.title: 10 dead as mob sets houses on fire in WB's Birbhum after TMC leader's murder
388.article_body: At least 10 people died after a mob allegedly set 10-12 houses on fire in West Bengal's Birbhum on Monday, fire officials said. "A total of 10 dead bodies have been recovered...seven bodies...retrieved from a single house," officials added. This comes after a TMC panchayat leader of Barshal village in Birbhum, Bhadu Sheikh, was killed in an alleged bomb attack.

389.title: Will be a big call by KKR to bowl Varun in death overs: Irfan Pathan
389.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said, "I think KKR can [sort their death bowling]...by adding a couple of overs of Varun Chakaravarthy. It's...a big call." KKR had economy rates of 9.24 runs per over and 8.28 runs per over respectively in the Indian and UAE leg of IPL 2021. Shreyas Iyer will lead KKR in IPL 2022.

390.title: Lockdown imposed on fuel prices lifted: Rahul Gandhi mocks PM Modi
390.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi-led government over hike in fuel prices. "The lockdown imposed on gas, diesel and petrol prices has been lifted. The government will now regularly do 'vikas' (development) in prices," tweeted Gandhi. "If PM is questioned about the inflation epidemic, he would say 'Thali Bajao' (bang plates)," he added.

391.title: Chennai civic body proposes to cancel licenses of shops violating plastic ban
391.article_body: The Chennai civic body is planning to cancel licences of shops and other establishments, which continue to sell banned plastic items in the city. The proposal comes in response to a writ petition from Tamil Nadu and Puducherry Plastic Manufacturers Association, challenging the state government's order, banning production and sale of 14 types of plastic items from January 1, 2019.

392.title: Sri Lanka sends troops to oversee fuel distribution amid economic crisis
392.article_body: Sri Lanka ordered its military to post soldiers at hundreds of gas stations to help distribute fuel amid a widespread shortage caused by the economic crisis in the country. "At least two...personnel will be deployed at every fuel pump," a military spokesman Nilantha Premaratne said. This comes after three people collapsed and died while waiting in queues to buy fuel.

393.title: They believe it's real me: Sudhanshu on his misogynistic character in Anupamaa
393.article_body: Speaking about his "misogynist" character in 'Anupamaa', actor Sudhanshu Pandey said he has been subjected to unending criticism for what 'Vanraj' does on the show. He added, "It was new to me because I wasn't part of the television industry." "They start believing...what I play on show is the real me...I had to bear the trolling...on social media," he said.

394.title: AAP's Sanjay Singh asks party workers to prepare for UP civic polls
394.article_body: AAP on Sunday decided to contest the forthcoming civic polls in UP and also make changes in the party's organisational structure. Presiding over a two-day meeting of AAP state executive, the party's state in-charge Sanjay Singh told party workers to start preparing for the UP civic polls. Singh stated that AAP had emerged as an alternative to other national parties.

395.title: There will be daily 'vikas' in petrol & diesel prices: Mallikarjun Kharge
395.article_body: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge said that by increasing fuel prices the PM Modi-led government is making money worth â‚¹10,000 crores by plundering the poor. Taking to Twitter, he said, "Congratulations to PM Modiji for achieving his 'target' of â‚¹1,000 per LPG cylinder...There will now be daily 'vikas' in petrol and diesel prices as well."

396.title: Sadhguru begins 30,000-km bike tour from London to India for 'Save Soil' campaign
396.article_body: Yoga guru Jaggi Vasudev, also known as Sadhguru, on Monday began his 30,000-kilometre motorbike journey from London to India as part of his 'Save Soil' awareness campaign. The 64-year-old's 100-day tour will take him across Europe and the Middle East, where he'll be meeting celebrities and environmentalists. "I'm not a scientist...but I know there's a soil crisis," he said earlier.

397.title: Read this before the outrage: Zomato CEO shares explainer on 10-minute delivery
397.article_body: After Zomato faced criticism for announcing a 10-minute food delivery service, CEO Deepinder Goyal clarified, "10-minute delivery is as safe for our delivery partners as 30-minute delivery." "Please take 2 minutes to read...this (before the outrage)," he wrote, sharing an explainer. It will only be for items that are standardised and can be dispatched within two minutes, the explainer said.

398.title: Which are the world's most polluted capitals according to World Air Quality Report 2021?
398.article_body: As per the World Air Quality Report 2021 by Swiss organisation IQAir, India's capital Delhi is the world's most polluted capital city with an average annual PM2.5 concentration of 96.4 Âµg/m3. Delhi is followed by Bangladesh's Dhaka, Chad's N'Djamena, Tajikistan's Dushanbe and Oman's Muscat. Delhi saw an annual increase of 14.6% in PM2.5 concentrations in 2021.

399.title: B'luru ACB conducts search on agents suspected of influencing govt officials
399.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) is conducting searches at locations of nine middlemen and agents suspected of influencing government officials in Bengaluru. The accused are suspected of being involved in malpractices and irregularities in the activities of the Bangalore Development Authority. About 100 officials are conducting the raids under supervision of Uma Prashant, Superintendent of Police.

400.title: India defeat Bangladesh by 110 runs, jump to 3rd on Women's World Cup points table
400.article_body: India defeated Bangladesh by 110 runs to register their third victory in the 2022 Women's World Cup. With the win, India have now jumped to the third spot on the points table. Yastika Bhatia was named Player of the Match for scoring 50(80). Earlier today, Australia handed South Africa their first defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup.

401.title: Makers planning to turn 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' into comic book series: Report
401.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' makers are planning to turn film into comic book series, Free Press Journal quoted source as saying. "Aditya [Chopra] wants to immortalise character of Jayeshbhai Jordaar...first thing they are planning to do is turn Jayeshbhai into comic book series. They feel character will appeal to universal set of audience...Adi wants...character to get...popular with kids!" source said.

402.title: Jack Ma-led Alibaba increases share buyback size to record $25 bn
402.article_body: Billionaire Jack Ma-led Alibaba has increased its share buyback programme to $25 billion, the largest ever repurchase plan by the e-commerce firm. In August, Alibaba had increased the programme from $10 billion to $15 billion. The firm's board has approved the programme, which will run through March 2024. Alibaba's shares rose 4.8% in Hong Kong following the news.

403.title: 64-yr-old Kerala man gets 73 yrs in jail for molesting 7-yr-old grandson
403.article_body: A Kerala court sentenced a 64-year-old man to 73 years in jail for sexually abusing his seven-year-old grandson in 2019 and fined him â‚¹1,60,000. The incident came to light after the accused's wife witnessed the crime. The man was awarded 20 years in jail under three sections of POCSO, 10 years for repeated offence and three years under Section 377.

404.title: Two foreign institutes want to set up campuses in India: Govt
404.article_body: Two foreign education institutes, based out of Italy and France, are interested in setting up campuses in India, MoS for Education Subhas Sarkar told Parliament. Milan-based Istituto Marangoni expressed interest to establish a foreign, fully independent higher education institute of fashion and design while the French side wants to set up a university campus for higher education courses, he added.
